result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott Mark Niebler

records.addlTxt: AMENDING the no contact order, signed and filed.
filed.
Court MODIFIES the no contact order to no VIOLENT contact with the victim.
Sworn as interpreter: Sandy Peplinski.

Defendant Scott Mark Niebler appeared by video.  Attorney Colleen Cullen appeared by video for Scott Mark Niebler.  Attorney Katherine Seelow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
DPA hearing held. State has filed an AMENDED information. Defense counsel acknowledges receipt, waives reading, and enters a temporary not guilty plea. Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 29.
Review hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights and Addendum, filed.
AMENDING the no contact order, signed and filed.
filed.

OFF THE RECORD- Defendant Scott Mark Niebler appeared by video. Attorney Bridget Krause appeared on behalf of Colleen Cullen by video for Scott Mark Niebler.  Attorney Katherine Seelow appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests an adjourned Deferred Prosecution Agreement Hearing. No objections from the State. Court grants request. Case adjourned to Br 29.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Scott Mark Niebler in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Defense counsel requests a DPA hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Filed: Original Transcript of SCHEDULING  (8 pages) commencing 06-15-2022, by KATHERINE LOCICERO.

Defendant Scott Mark Niebler in court with attorney Paige Styler for Colleen Cullen.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a DPA hearing. Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Court held colloquy with the defendant regarding his right to have an in-person hearing. State has filed an AMENDED information. Defense counsel acknowledges receipt, waives reading, and enters a temporary not guilty plea. Court beings plea colloquy with the defendant. For reasons stated on the record, Court orders matter adjourned for a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Sworn as interpreter: Sue Gudenkauf.

Defendant Scott Mark Niebler in court with attorney Paige Styler for Colleen Cullen.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DPA hearing held. Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Court held colloquy with the defendant regarding his right to have an in-person hearing. State has filed an AMENDED information. Defense counsel acknowledges receipt, waives reading, and enters a temporary not guilty plea.  

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 29.
Jury Instructions, filed.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights and Addendum, flied.

regarding use of videotaped statements, signed and filed.
regarding use of videotaped statements, filed.

Defendant Scott Mark Niebler in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel requests a DPA hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (24 pages) commencing 05-17-22 by Karla Roque.
Sworn as interpreter: Sandy Peplinski.

Defendant Scott Mark Niebler in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Harold Almas - MPD Police Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense requests to be heard as to the no contact order. State objects to modification of the no contact order. Court does not modify the no contact order at this time.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Sworn as interpreter: Sandy Peplinski.

Defendant Scott Mark Niebler in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail/bond hearing held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense requests the no contact order be modified. Arguments heard. Court takes the request under advisement. Case remains calendared as previously set in Branch 29.

Defendant Scott Mark Niebler in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a bail/bond hearing and a preliminary hearing.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. For reasons stated on the record, Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing.  Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Scott Mark Niebler in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Scott Mark Niebler in custody.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scott Mark Niebler appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
